item.title: Scans of my ID cards sent to the FBI, to Mr. Rogalski (Assistant Legal Attaché, U.S. Department of State, F.B.I.) and Mr. Manjarrez (F.B.I.)
item.description:
Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2021-10-05_0120_0800_i_send_the_fbi_scans-of-my-id-cards.pdf

From: Vincent B. Le Corre

To: Adam Rogalski (Legal Attaché/State Department), Mahonri Manjarrez (FBI language specialist)

Answer sent by email to Messrs. Rogalski and Manjarrez on October 05, 2021, at 01:20 (am) China Standard Time.

item.title: Eric Andrieu, lawyer, Péchenard & Associés
item.description: From: Eric Andrieu (Péchenard & Associés law firm) To: Vincent B. Le Corre On October 27, 2015, I received an email from McDonald’s France lawyer Éric Andrieu of the Péchenard & Associés law firm. https://archive20210730.auxjournalistes.com/docs/emails/McDonaldsReceivedFrom/2015-10-27-16h00-Eric_Andrieu_Avocat_McDonalds_France_Redacted.pdf The lawyer commits an exceptionally serious mistake (legal malpractice) by confirming “to [his] clients that the sweepstakes [note: actually a serious fraud] was in compliance with French and European law.” This is obviously false. Either he is dangerously incompetent, or he is complicit.

item.title: Malcolm Hicks, Corporate Vice President of McDonald’s Europe and General Counsel
item.description:
On October 23, 2015, I receive an email from Malcolm Hicks <Malcolm.Hicks@eu.mcd.com> who is the Corporate Vice President of McDonald’s Europe.

From: Malcolm Hicks <Malcolm.Hicks@eu.mcd.com>

Subject: France Monopoly Game Query

Date received: October 23, 2015 at 05:34 +0800 (Beijing time)

To: Vincent B. Le Corre

item.title: Françoise de Borda, former general counsel of McDonald’s France
item.description:
Via certified mail with proof of receipt requested

From: Françoise de Borda (Francoise.deBorda@fr.mcd.com) To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

If I recall correctly, a copy of the mail was sent to a French Ministerial Officer who I now accuse of being corrupted.

Translation coming soon. (Note of 2023-04-13: quick note, this event happened in 2012 and I published it, if I am not mistaken, on 2022-09-21T20:49:00+08:00. Back then I wrote “translation coming soon” but I currently don’t have time to translate what was said in French. It’s an important event but not that important compared to what I am currently explaining to the FBI which is the priority.)

Françoise de Borda, directrice juridique de McDonald’s France, me réponds pour la première et pour la dernière fois. Elle ment.
